headline: Latest News In AI Chips - Expanding AI Infrastructure Connectivity With Astera Labs Developments
summary: Astera Labs, Inc. has announced the expansion of its connectivity solutions with a focus on custom offerings to support the growing complexity of next-generation AI infrastructure. By leveraging NVIDIA's NVLink Fusion ecosystem, Astera Labs aims to provide hyperscalers with custom solutions to optimize performance, energy efficiency, and cost for varied AI workloads. The company's initiative highlights the need for tailored connectivity in heterogeneous systems, enabling infrastructure...

headline: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

content.title: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
content.summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

headline: Nvidia Stock Gains. It Has This Key Advantage Over Amazon’s New AI Chips.
summary: Nvidia  was rising early on Wednesday.  Although the chip maker faces competition from new artificial-intelligence hardware made by  Amazon.com  markets seem confident it can defend its leading position.  Nvidia shares were up 0.5% at $182.34 in premarket trading.

headline: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.

content.title: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
content.summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.

headline: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

content.title: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
content.summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

headline: Marvell to Buy Celestial AI; Shares Jump on Bullish Remarks
summary: On a post-earnings conference call with analysts on Tuesday, Marvell said it’s more bullish about revenue growth next year and predicted that custom chip sales will increase 20%.  Large customers have renewed orders, and Marvell said there won’t be a repeat of previous “air pockets,” when sales in that unit have declined.  The company also announced plans to acquire startup Celestial AI for at least $3.25 billion, a move it said would bolster the artificial intelligence push.

content.title: Marvell to Buy Celestial AI; Shares Jump on Bullish Remarks
content.summary: On a post-earnings conference call with analysts on Tuesday, Marvell said it’s more bullish about revenue growth next year and predicted that custom chip sales will increase 20%.  Large customers have renewed orders, and Marvell said there won’t be a repeat of previous “air pockets,” when sales in that unit have declined.  The company also announced plans to acquire startup Celestial AI for at least $3.25 billion, a move it said would bolster the artificial intelligence push.

headline: Nvidia servers speed up AI models from China's Moonshoot AI and others tenfold
summary: Nvidia on Wednesday published new data showing that its latest artificial intelligence server can improve the performance ​of new models - including two popular ones from China - by 10 times.  The ‌data comes as the AI world has shifted its focus from training AI models, where Nvidia dominates ‌the market, to putting them to use for millions of users, where Nvidia faces far more competition from rivals such as Advanced Micro Devices and Cerebras.  Nvidia's data focused on what are known as mixture-of-expert AI models.

content.title: Nvidia servers speed up AI models from China's Moonshoot AI and others tenfold
content.summary: Nvidia on Wednesday published new data showing that its latest artificial intelligence server can improve the performance ​of new models - including two popular ones from China - by 10 times.  The ‌data comes as the AI world has shifted its focus from training AI models, where Nvidia dominates ‌the market, to putting them to use for millions of users, where Nvidia faces far more competition from rivals such as Advanced Micro Devices and Cerebras.  Nvidia's data focused on what are known as mixture-of-expert AI models.

headline: Nvidia Scores Lobbying Win as Congress Rejects Chip Export Bill
summary: The so-called GAIN AI Act would require chipmakers, including Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices Inc., to give American customers first dibs on their powerful AI chips before selling in China and other arms-embargoed countries.  A person familiar with the defense bill said it is not in the bill, though the situation could still change unexpectedly.

content.title: Nvidia Scores Lobbying Win as Congress Rejects Chip Export Bill
content.summary: The so-called GAIN AI Act would require chipmakers, including Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices Inc., to give American customers first dibs on their powerful AI chips before selling in China and other arms-embargoed countries.  A person familiar with the defense bill said it is not in the bill, though the situation could still change unexpectedly.

headline: AMD’s Half-Price Cloud Strategy Narrows Gap With NVIDIA

headline: AMD vs. Texas Instruments: Which chip stock should you buy
summary: In the latest installment of Yahoo Finance's Good Buy or Goodbye, Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler lays out to Josh Lipton her outlook on two AI chip players: Texas Instruments (TXN) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). Tengler underlines the leadership of AMD CEO Lisa Su and strong valuations fueling the chip name, while pointing to Texas Instruments' slowing dividend growth and its cuts to guidance as reasons to not invest in the semiconductor company. Also catch Nancy Tengler talk about shifting sentiments in the AI ecosystem. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: AMD vs. Texas Instruments: Which chip stock should you buy
content.description:
In the latest installment of Yahoo Finance's Good Buy or Goodbye, Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler lays out to Josh Lipton her outlook on two AI chip players: Texas Instruments (TXN) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD).

Tengler underlines the leadership of AMD CEO Lisa Su and strong valuations fueling the chip name, while pointing to Texas Instruments' slowing dividend growth and its cuts to guidance as reasons to not invest in the semiconductor company.

Also catch Nancy Tengler talk about shifting sentiments in the AI ecosystem.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Nvidia’s Huang Unsure Whether China Would Accept Its H200 Chips
summary: Addressing reporters at the US Capitol, Huang said he and Trump talked about export controls but declined to offer specifics.  The Nvidia chief’s meeting with the president comes after Trump administration officials discussed whether to allow the H200 to be sold in China.

content.title: Nvidia’s Huang Unsure Whether China Would Accept Its H200 Chips
content.summary: Addressing reporters at the US Capitol, Huang said he and Trump talked about export controls but declined to offer specifics.  The Nvidia chief’s meeting with the president comes after Trump administration officials discussed whether to allow the H200 to be sold in China.
